definition: Ai (c. 2000 BC), sixth of legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God, also known as Li 釐|厘[Li2]
sorrow/grief/pity/to grieve for/to pity/to lament/to condole

sentences.english: His long, improvised dirges will ring forever in my ears.
sentences.chinese: 他長篇與即興的哀歌將永遠迴繞於我的耳際。

sentences.english: Monody shall not wake the mariner.
sentences.chinese: 孤零零的哀歌將不會喚醒水手。

sentences.english: Hear ye this word which I take up against you, even a lamentation, O house of Israel.
sentences.chinese: 以色列家阿，要聽我爲你們所作的哀歌。

sentences.english: It is elegiac rather than nostalgic.
When the time comes, he will read or recite this lamentation.
sentences.chinese: 時候一到，他將宣讀或背誦這首哀歌。

sentences.english: This is a lamentation, and shall be for a lamentation.
sentences.chinese: 這是哀歌，也必用以作哀歌。

sentences.english: This is a lamentation, and shall be for a lamentation.
sentences.chinese: 這是哀歌，也必用以作哀歌。

sentences.english: He died at the end of this wistful and elegiac novel.
sentences.chinese: 在這本情意綿綿的哀歌式小說的末尾，他結束了一生。

sentences.english: We only smoke the Lamentations. Just right for a cigarette.
sentences.chinese: 我們只抽“耶利米哀歌”那章，正好配香菸。

definition: sad melody/stirring strains/elegy/dirge/threnody/sing with solemn fervor
lit. as if weeping and complaining (idiom)/fig. mournful (music or singing)
